intro: Claytonia caulescens, commonly known as the stalked springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and typically grows in moist, woodland habitats. The plant features a short, slender stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and appear in clusters at the base of the stem. Claytonia caulescens is known for its early spring blooming and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
